# How to be a Kick-Ass Teacher

![](https://students-gschool-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/asset/file/633/galvanize.png)

---

# Learning Objectives
By the end of this workshop, you will be able to:

1. Write 2-3 learning objectives that meet the ‘4M’ criteria
1. Describe and demonstrate the teaching technique ‘Post It’
1. Describe and demonstrate the teaching technique ‘Targeted Questioning’


---

# Learning Objectives
By the end of this workshop, you will be able to:

1. Write 2-3 learning objectives that meet the ‘4M’ criteria
1. Describe the purpose of crafting learning objectives


---


# Learning Objectives

 A description of what the student will know and be able to do by the end of a lesson.

![](https://images.duckduckgo.com/iu/?u=https%3A%2F%2Farticulate-heroes.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fuploads%2Farticle%2Ffeatured_image%2F2254%2FHow-to-Write-Good-E-Learning-Objectives-for-Your-Online-Course.jpg&f=1)

---
# 4M Criteria

1. Manageable
1. Measurable
1. Made First
1. Most Important

![](https://images.duckduckgo.com/iu/?u=http%3A%2F%2Fmysticalnumbers.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2012%2F06%2FNumber-4-on-fire.png&f=1)

---

# Manageable

By the end of (a specified time period), the student will be able to:

1. Objective One
1. Objective Two
1. Objective Three

---

# Measurable

## Yes or No?

---

## Examples
By the end of this workshop, you will be able to:

- Inspect DOM nodes and elements
- Modify existing DOM elements
- Create new DOM elements
- Describe the Document Object Model

---

## Non-Examples
  * Understand the DOM
  * Complete a project that uses JavaScript

---

# Your Turn!

* Write 2-3 learning objectives that are manageable and measurable.
* Find and use verbs from Bloom's Taxonomy!

---

# 4M Criteria

1. Manageable
1. Measurable
1. Made First
1. Most Important

![](https://images.duckduckgo.com/iu/?u=http%3A%2F%2Fmysticalnumbers.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2012%2F06%2FNumber-4-on-fire.png&f=1)

# Learning Objectives
By the end of this workshop, you will be able to:

1. Write 2-3 learning objectives that meet the ‘4M’ criteria
1. Describe the purpose of crafting learning objectives



---

# Learning Objectives
By the end of this workshop, you will be able to:

1. Write 2-3 learning objectives that meet the ‘4M’ criteria
1. Describe and demonstrate the teaching technique ‘Post It’
1. Describe and demonstrate the teaching technique ‘Targeted Questioning’

---

# Learning Objectives
By the end of this workshop, you will be able to:


Describe and demonstrate the teaching technique ‘Post It’

---

# Post It

1. Go over you objectives at the beginning of your lesson


---

# Post It

1. Go over you objectives at the beginning of your lesson
1. Review each objective after you've covered it

---

# Post It

1. Go over you objectives at the beginning of your lesson
1. Review each objective after you've covered it
1. Go over you objectives at the end of your lesson

---

# Your Turn!

* Create a slide or poster that displays you objectives.
* Practice the beginning, middle and end of a lesson.

# Learning Objectives
By the end of this workshop, you will be able to:

1. Write 2-3 learning objectives that meet the ‘4M’ criteria
1. Describe and demonstrate the teaching technique ‘Post It’
1. Describe and demonstrate the teaching technique ‘Targeted Questioning’

---

# Learning Objectives
By the end of this workshop, you will be able to:

Describe and demonstrate the teaching technique ‘Targeted Questioning’

---
#  Great Teaching

## Perhaps the most salient characteristic of a great teacher is her ability to recognize the difference between 'I taught it' and 'They learned it.'


-- Doug Lemov, _Teach Like a Champion_

![](http://teachlikeachampion.com/wp-content/uploads/1610_uncommon_slide-1079x446.jpg)

---
# Checks For Understanding

* Assessments that get graded after class
* Real-time checks for understanding that happen in the classroom

---

# Targeted Questioning

1. Ask a question aloud
1. Provide Wait time
1. Collect the data through Turn and Talk, Show Me or Cold Call

---

# Your Turn!

3x

1. Ask a Targeted Question
1. Do it again, and get feedback
1. Ask a Targeted Question and apply the feedback from your partner



---

# Debrief

* What do you know now that you didn't know before this session?

* What can you do now that you couldn't do before this session?

![](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1487732051747-883a9d609c1e?dpr=1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1500&h=994&q=80&cs=tinysrgb&crop=)
